original: Landberg, Leif Robert Harald, postmästare, Älmhult, f. 12/2/83 i Visby av kapt. m. m. Robert Victor L. o. Emilia von Segebaden. G. 1. 12 m. Ruth Maria Kilander, d. 29; 2. 30 m. Elsa Llelena Winberg. Barn: Torkel Robert Fredrik f. 13, Brynhild Elsa Ingrid Emilia 15, Bo Karl Harald 31. — Mog:ex. i Upps. 04, jur. stud. i Upps. 05-08. E. o. postexp. i mell. distr. 05, e. bitr. v. järnv:posten där 07, bitr. po.stexp. där 10, postexp. där s. à., i Söderhamn 13, Nyköp. 16, poist-assist. där 25, förste postassist. i Härnösand 29, postmäst. i Hultsfred 32, i Jörn 33 o. i Älmhult sed. 39. Var i Nyköp. förest, f. skatteavd. 18-28. Bokför, o. sifferkontr. v. folkhush:-komm. foderbyrå i Nyköp. 18-19, sekr. i Södermani. sekt. av Posttj :m. fören. 18-26, i Ängermanl. sekt. 31, ordf. i Södermani. sekt. 27-29, i Kristianstad-Blek. sekt. 44-47.
translated: Landberg, Leif Robert Harald, postmaster, Älmhult, born on February 12, 1883 in Visby, son of captain (military) Robert Victor L. and Emilia von Segebaden. Married 1st on December 12, 19xx to Ruth Maria Kilander, died on the 29th; 2nd on the 30th to Elsa Llelena Winberg. Children: Torkel Robert Fredrik, born in 1913; Brynhild Elsa Ingrid Emilia, born in 1915; Bo Karl Harald, born in 1931. Completed military service in Uppsala in 1904, studied law at Uppsala University from 1905-1908. Worked as a temporary postal assistant in the central district in 1905, became an assistant at the railway post office in 1907, promoted to assistant postmaster there in 1910, postmaster there in the same year, then moved to Söderhamn in 1913, Nyköping in 1916, post office assistant in 1925, first post office assistant in Härnösand in 1929, postmaster in Hultsfred in 1932, in Jörn in 1933, and in Älmhult since 1939. Worked as the head of the tax department in Nyköping from 1918-1928. Served as a bookkeeping and numerical control officer at the agricultural bureau in Nyköping from 1918-1919, secretary in the Södermanland section of the Postal Employees' Association from 1918-1926, in the Ångermanland section from 1931, chairman of the Södermanland section from 1927-1929, and in the Kristianstad-Blekinge section from 1944-1947.
